text:
Introducing AWS RoboMaker WorldForge: a new
capability that makes robotic simulation easier!

AWS WorldForge makes it faster, simpler, and
less expensive to create a multitude of 3D virtual

worlds to simulate your robots in. Robotic companies are 
building increasingly sophisticated robots with autonomous

capabilities and artificial intelligence. To develop 
these capabilities, developer teams need simulation

to test and train their robots. Scaling simulation unlocks 
the ability to make regression testing more robust,

reinforcement learning faster, and synthetic 
data generation more affordable. Until today,

it was difficult for robotics teams to do simulation 
because building even just one 3D world was costly,

time-consuming, and required specialized skills in 3D 
modeling and knowledge of simulation engines.

Given the investment needed to create a single simulation 
world, it was almost impossible to build enough worlds to

effectively scale simulation. With WorldForge, robotics 
developers can easily increase the scale, speed, and

variance of simulation, improving the quality of 
production code and accelerating time to market.

In this demo, we'll show you how to create dozens of 
randomized, realistic simulation worlds automatically

Before you generate worlds, you define your 
environment template, which will be used to

generate randomized stimulation worlds. WorldForge makes 
it easy to customize the assets in your worlds and set

variation parameters of your simulation worlds. Starting 
from a pre-made template, you define the number and

type of rooms you want and specify the room's area 
and ratios. You can customize a room type, layout,

and even say which rooms will be next to each other.
Finally, in the room itself, you can choose custom

floor materials, wall materials, and furniture types. After the 
template is defined, QA engineers and robotic developers

can easily generate multiple randomized simulation worlds for 
different application testing and reinforcement learning scenarios.

Now, I'll show you how easy it is to generate worlds. First, 
define the number of variations needed for the floor plan

and the interior variations. Then, simply click "Generate" 
the new world and create. Look at that!

We generated 50 worlds based on the parameters in the 
template. Notice that each world is a variation of the template.

You can tag these worlds with metadata so that you can 
easily search for them later. For example, you could tag

a world with "3BR" for 3-bedroom, hardwood floor, 
or even high-density furnishings.

You can also use these worlds paired with RoboMaker's batch 
API and highly scalable infrastructure to quickly and easily

run large-scale simulation workloads. We're really excited to 
make it easier and faster for robot builders to create simulation

worlds, so they can do more testing, better testing, and 
bring their robots and features to market faster!
